title: Why fascism is so tempting— and how your data could power it - Yuval Noah Harari

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker think is the main problem with using the term "fascist" in modern times?

options.label: A
options.text: That it is too easy to use and people use it too loosely.

options.label: B
options.text: That it is too hard to understand and people don't know what it means.

options.label: C
options.text: That it is too associated with nationalism and people get it confused.

options.label: D
options.text: That it is too associated with communism and people get it confused.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main difference between nationalism and fascism?

options.label: A
options.text: Nationalism is good and fascism is bad.

options.label: B
options.text: Nationalism tells people to care about their nation, while fascism tells people to care only about their nation.

options.label: C
options.text: Nationalism is about being loyal to one's country, while fascism is about being loyal to one's family.

options.label: D
options.text: Nationalism is about being loyal to one's country, while fascism is about being loyal to one's profession.

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker say is the danger of fascism?

options.label: A
options.text: That it is a hideous monster that can be easily defeated.

options.label: B
options.text: That it makes people see themselves as more beautiful than they really are.

options.label: C
options.text: That it denies all identities except the national identity.

options.label: D
options.text: That it is a form of nationalism.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main technological danger that threatens the future of democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: The merger of information technology with biotechnology.

options.label: B
options.text: The rise of artificial intelligence and machine learning.

options.label: C
options.text: The concentration of data in the hands of the government or a small elite.

options.label: D
options.text: The use of algorithms to manipulate people's feelings.

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker say is the best safeguard for democracy?

options.label: A
options.text: To prevent the concentration of data in the hands of the government or a small elite.

options.label: B
options.text: To make sure that distributed data processing is at least as efficient as centralized data processing.

options.label: C
options.text: To prevent the use of algorithms to manipulate people's feelings.

options.label: D
options.text: To make sure that people are not manipulated by those who control the data.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main responsibility of individuals in order to prevent the return of fascism and the rise of new dictatorships?

options.label: A
options.text: To get to know their own weaknesses and make sure that they do not become a weapon in the hands of the enemies of democracy.

options.label: B
options.text: To rise up against the government or corporations that control the data.

options.label: C
options.text: To use social media to spread awareness about the dangers of fascism and dictatorships.

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore the dangers of fascism and dictatorships and focus on other issues.

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker say is the difference between corporations and governments in terms of controlling data?

options.label: A
options.text: That corporations are more transparent and governments are more secretive.

options.label: B
options.text: That corporations are more accountable and governments are more authoritarian.

options.label: C
options.text: That the difference is more apparent than real.

options.label: D
options.text: That corporations are more powerful and governments are more weak.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the prospect of humans becoming gods in the 21st century?

options.label: A
options.text: That it is unlikely and will not happen.

options.label: B
options.text: That it is possible but will not happen soon.

options.label: C
options.text: That it is more likely and will happen faster due to the development of artificial intelligence and genetic engineering.

options.label: D
options.text: That it is not relevant to the discussion about fascism and dictatorships.

multiple-choice.question: What does the speaker say is the main reason why people are willing to take risks and try new technologies in times of crisis?

options.label: A
options.text: That they are more optimistic about the future.

options.label: B
options.text: That they are more pessimistic about the future.

options.label: C
options.text: That they are willing to try anything to escape their current situation.

options.label: D
options.text: That they are more willing to take risks in times of crisis.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the likelihood of humanity scraping through the current crisis and emerging unscathed?

options.label: A
options.text: It is very likely and humanity will emerge unscathed.

options.label: B
options.text: It is possible but not guaranteed.

options.label: C
options.text: It is unlikely and humanity will not emerge unscathed.

options.label: D
options.text: It is impossible and humanity will be destroyed.

options.label: B
options.text: A philosophy concerned with minimizing the greatest amount of harm to the greatest number of people.

options.label: C
options.text: A philosophy concerned with maximizing the greatest amount of profit for the greatest number of people.

options.label: B
options.text: He did nothing and allowed the product to remain on the shelves.

options.label: B
options.text: By developing tamper-resistant packaging and regaining the trust of its customers.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They saw a group of curious baboons

multiple-choice.question: What is the main message of the speaker's talk?

options.label: A
options.text: We should study animal behavior more

options.label: B
options.text: We should recognize animal grief and love

options.label: C
